content.description: This is a tall and technical slab climb. The route is divided in the middle by a horizontal crack that is great for both your hands and your feet. The crux leaving this position of comfort and edging you way up to the lip.
content.protection: Have a pad and a good spotter.
content.location: The slab located on the farthest left side of the Bruce Lee Wall. This is located on the western side of the boulder.

content.description: A classic low angel slab. Edge your way up the blank face on small crystal edges. Half way up the face there is a horizontal crack that provides a momentary break before you have to resume edging up, and up, and up!
content.protection: A pad and a good spotter.
content.location: Located to the right of Wet Bottom. This is the second route from the far left of the Bruce Lee Wall. On the western side of the boulder.

content.description: This line requires that you climb this slightly overhanging mass composed of numerous blocks. Sit start on the top of the hill. Make a powerful move off the ground and then its fun positive holds all the way to the top.
content.protection: Situate your pad well on top of the rocks. The landing is on a hill so make sure you have either two pads or a spotter!
content.location: On the right side of the Bruce Lee Wall

content.description: This line is characterized by a thin seam that traverse where two large roofs meet. The initial sequence is fun and fluid. Sit start low on the right angling crack, and traverse the seam right. Then summon the strength of Bruce Lee to transition to the arete.
content.location: This is the first climb you come to at the top of the granite slab from the trail. Located on the West side of the Bruce Lee Wall.

content.description: "Start on main face with left on top of the rounded fracture. Throw right and head up. Exit through the chimney for the V3 finish." Minnesota River Valley Bouldering
content.protection: This was given an X rating in the original guide, so be careful.
content.location: This is located on the left side of the face just to the right of the overhung roofs.

content.description: The Bruce Lee Wall is the first of the large boulders you will encounter from the trail. The left side of this block is defined by a double overhang; whereas, the right face is vertical and defined crack that veers right. The overhang has a very level landing, but the right face is located above a rocky hill - be careful to pad uneven landings with care!
